titlestmt.titleproper: Plymouth, Ill. Plymouth Congregational Church records, 1836-1949.
titlestmt.author: William McCarthy

maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Monday October 5, 2020 at 15:22

did.unittitle: Plymouth, Ill. Plymouth Congregational Church records, 1836-1949.
did.abstract: The Plymouth Congregational Church was founded in Round Prairie in 1836. A building was built the following year, functioning both as a schoolhouse and church. The church worshiped jointly with the local Presbyterians under the same reverend. The church moved to a more prominent location in Plymouth, a city in Hancock County, in 1854. In 1919, the church merged with Presbyterians from the town, keeping the name Plymouth Congregational Church. The church officially closed down in 1959. This collection includes board meeting minutes, articles of incorporation, reports and a list of members.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Plymouth, Ill. Plymouth Congregational Church records, 1836-1890, RG5263. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was received in 2014 and given the accession number 2014-110.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: First processed by Rachel Cohen in 2014. Re-processed by William McCarthy, June 2017, using DACS second edition. Additional changes made by William McCarthy in June 2018.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Plymouth Congregational Church was founded in Round Prairie in 1836. A building was built the following year, functioning both as a schoolhouse and church. The church worshiped jointly with the local Presbyterians under the same reverend. The church moved to a more prominent location in Plymouth, a city in Hancock County, in 1854. In 1919, the church merged with Presbyterians from the town, keeping the name Plymouth Congregational Church. The church officially closed down in 1959.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes board meeting minutes, articles of incorporation, reports and a list of members.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has been arranged chronologically.

did.unittitle: Articles of Incorporation and Meeting Minutes
